main event: On August 3, 1953, two unidentified luminous objects were observed by two independent observers in Twinsburg, Ohio for approximately 15-20 minutes.
interesting points: The objects appeared larger than most stars and much brighter than a planet., Observers reported that the objects hovered, changed direction, and gradually disappeared., The estimated speed of the objects was at least 400 mph, possibly much higher., There were no confirmed reports of air traffic during the sighting., The sighting occurred under clear moonlight conditions, and both witnesses stated they had never seen such objects before.
